subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Rise of Evangelicalism
description: A 60-second lesson on The Rise of Evangelicalism.

hook.text: One in four Americans is evangelical. They shaped elections, culture wars, and policy. How did they get so powerful?

buildup.text: Evangelicalism stresses personal conversion, biblical authority, and active mission. It's Christianity's fastest sector.

discovery.text: Billy Graham brought evangelicalism into the mainstream. Megachurches and televangelism followed in the 1980s.

twist.text: Political evangelicalism is a recent invention. Before 1970, most evangelicals avoided politics entirely.

climax.text: Evangelicalism's political power is both its strength and its crisis. Many young evangelicals are walking away.

punchline.text: Evangelicalism shaped America's politics. Now its own youth are leaving.

quiz.question: When did evangelicals become politically active in America?
